comments.author: Sp0rk

comments.text:
+Hecatedevotee2009
this is the longst post I have ever made, and it's not my best, but it's a 
very important topic and very close to my heart so I thought I should 
contribute in some way.
I read this and thought pretty hard about offering a point of observation.  
Being male, I am quite frightened when voicing my opinion as most women 
will shame me or tell me my views are wrong.  I am a heterosexual male.  
But for about 6 years of my life, I was raped repeatedly.  Granted in that 
case I really had no way to stop it other than being responsible for myself 
and my situation and ensuring I was no longer in it.  So I tend to agree 
with Lilith's point of view in that some people are really mentally ill.  
Granted you also have quite a few very valid points.  Many people are just 
spoiled and want what they want, when they want it.

The most important thing I wish to convey is this though.  After being in 
those situations for so many years, where it also became 'normal' to me, I 
obviously needed to get hep.  Lilith is right about the brainwashing people 
have about victim blaming, instead of being responsible for the situations 
I put myself in.  In all my therapy, I was given one gem, that is 
deep-seated in me now.  I can control everything I do, but I cannot control 
others. And if I don't want something bad to happen to me, don't put myself 
in risky situations.  By no means does this alleviate guilt by the 
perpetrator, but I have to take responsibility for my part as well.  I 
can't die because my parachute doesn't open if I never skydive in the first 
place.  Risk taking behaviour is like gambling, You might get away with it 
for a while, but one day you'll lose.  And there is no behaviour analytics 
agency or government board that I have ever heard of that doesn't 
categorize drinking as risk taking behaviour. 

You say her blood alcohol is .13 so people were pouring drinks down her 
throat because she was too drunk to stop herself?  how did she get too 
drunk to say no to more drinks in the first place?

You say she was too young to know better?  Then why the heck did she know 
about the drinking party beforehand?  Why did she plan on going to it, 
betray the trust of her parents, sneak out, consume booze with boys she 
felt were popular and cute, then expect those boys to carry the burden of 
responsibility for her well-being instead of her being responsible for 
herself?  If she's a minor, doesn't that put the burden of responsibility 
on the parents to keep her out of dangerous situations?

Those guys need to pay for what they did.  But by the same token, she needs 
to have a LOT of priviledges removed from her for a while until she learns 
to act responsibly.  The tax payers shouldn't be footing the bill for 
people acting like idiots, getting hammered, then getting into trouble.  
The boys were drunk too obviously, and obviously minors.  So obviously they 
weren't making good decisions themselves.

One last point, sorry for the length of this post...

When I was raped so many times anally, and forced to perform fellatio, it 
caused medical damage, pain, and humiliation...thus trauma, because I WAS 
AWAKE AND TOTALLY COGNISANT.  If I was passed out, the trauma is MUCH 
smaller.  If I had open heart surgery while awake, it would be 
significantly different, than under anesthesia, and yes, these are 
comparable allegorical statements.  The boys were idiots, and did something 
very wrong, she was an idiot and got herself into a very bad situation.  
Everyone f*d up in this situation.  Not victim blaming, but asserting 
everyone is responsible for their own actions and it's absurd to think 
others are responsible for my well-being, and I am under no onus to take 
care of myself.

So asserting that Lilith should get some help because she experiences her 
situation differently than you is very condescending, derogatory, and 
childish.  She may not have worded her arguments very well much of the 
time, but after your traumatic experience you seem not to have grasped the 
concept of personal culpability.  People should be allowed to do whatever 
they want and if something goes wrong it's someone else's fault.  You 
probably think you should be allowed to put your baby in a bear pen at the 
zoo, then if something bad happens, the bear should be put down and 
punished.  Sexual congress is part of human nature, heck it's in every 
living thing's nature, and booze lowers our inhibitions and ability to 
reason, SO DON'T DRINK IF YOU AREN'T IN A SAFE PLACE TO DO SO.  And if you 
do, in a dangerous environment, as this was, don't flutter your eyes and 
say how innocent you were and how traumatized you are...One, she was 
supposedly asleep, and couldn't feel anything, or recall the event, thank 
goodness, or that coould have been really traumatic...Two, having noting to 
do with rape, did the prosecutor charge her or fine her for underage 
drinking?  Sounds like both got away with a lot.  Or do we forget about her 
illegal drinking because she had potentially non-consentual sex, I wasn't 
there, so I don't know what the real situation was.  Would her drinking 
have been considered more serious if she hadnt been raped?  Would anyone 
have done anything about it then.  It happened before the purported rape, 
not after, so she put herself in a situation when she couldn't make 
rational decisions.  She was not surruptitiously drugged.  She drugged 
herself.  He took advantage of that.  punish them both, or neither at 
all....

I strongly believe that the prosecutor didn't drop the case so he could get 
a free buffet at Sizzler from the kids family....

My two cents, I'm sure many disagree, but it's only my opinion, I chose to 
share it as you were being very condescending towards Lilith, and I found 
it very important that she is aware that there are rational thinking people 
that also support her view of being responsible for your own actions 
instead of expecting everyone else to act on a higher level than we do 
ourselves, and expecting others to protect and care for us because we 
shouldn't have to be careful for our own actions.

I can't wait to get pulled over drunk driving and when the cop asks me 
what's going on I'll just say I wasn't going to drive I most certainly 
didn't want to, but the bartender kept giving me drinks after I was too 
drunk to stop, and then my blood alchohol was so high I couldn't make good 
decisions, so he took advantage of me and coerced me into spending all the 
money I had for a taxi, instead spending it on his booze because I didn't 
know better at that point.  It was too cold outside to sleep in the park 
because I had no money left, and far too far to walk.  So it's not my fault 
I'm trying to drive. 

Logically, it is not different.  No offense is meant toward anyone 
suffering from events like these, as I have too so I understand.  But that 
doesn't give us the right to charge people.  if she doesn't remember 
anything, how does she know who actually raped her?  The video?  Before 
that, how did she know that the guy wasn't drunk too and that she didn't 
try and mount him?  Her blood alchohol was .13 so she was unconscious you 
say?  So at a blood alchohol of .13 how did she walk into the hospital 
cognisant and awake?  How did she coherently explain to her mother that her 
genitalia hurt?  Drunk driving charges sometimes have that BAC (lood 
Alchohol Level) or higher and they ar functional, just clumsy.  The boy 
wasn't tested, was he sober or any less impaired?  There are a lot of 
questions, no one should judge that wasn't there until all of the 
information is present.
comments.author: Darren Maurer

"pouring drinks down her throat" and helping her along because of her age 
and body size she would've been to intoxicated to have been making the 
decision to drink more on her own much less enough to become stone cold 
unconscious and have that high of a blood alcohol level hours later.  Okay 
examples I gave you 3 posts ago you still haven't answered me about them 
but to say that people have a mental illness and they can't control 
themselves, except they can. Rapists can decide not to rape. Do you have a 
rebuttal for that besides silence or no they can't?
comments.author: Hecatedevotee2009

comments.text:
+Hecatedevotee2009​ Looking back on the posts, I did answer all the 
questions. I even have one for you: do you condone her underage drinking? 
If she hadn't been so reckless she wouldn't have put herself in such a 
risky situation. I'm not saying she put herself up to be raped but she 
would have a clearer mind while sober.
comments.author: Lilith Manson

comments.text:
+Lilith Manson Of course I do.  But wearing blue jeans and a t-shirt and 
knowing someone and not knowing he wants to rape me and not being able to 
fight him off if he goes off and decides to rape me isn't my fault. It's 
his. Because he made the CHOICE to rape me. That's not my fault.  Not my 
responsibility. I didn't do anything to bring it on. I didn't say or do 
anything that made it so I deserved it. Because absolutely nothing I say or 
do or anybody says or does means that they deserve to raped or that they 
brought the rape on themselves and if they are raped they need to take the 
responsibility for themselves.  Again you are victim blaming. And you still 
haven't answered all of the questions I have asked in all of my posts.  And 
your attitude is some of the attitudes and thoughts and beliefs that they 
have in the Muslim countries where rape culture is rampant. Which is why 
rape culture  is becoming to prevalent here in the US. Please answer all 
the questions I've asked through all of my posts no bullshit it's all 
important.
comments.author: Hecatedevotee2009

comments.text:
+Hecatedevotee2009 All you seem to know how to do is blame others. Do you 
take responsibilities for your mistakes? And don't bullshit me, this is 
relevant.
comments.author: Lilith Manson

top_comment.text:
I am fucking sick of football player and political entitlements. Any 
political connections investigated and arrested with if there were favors. 
These men should be in prison and I wish somebody would kick the asses of 
both the high school boys and girls who fucking taunted her. I FUCKING HATE 
everyone who supports them. Fuck you pieces of shit who were involved.﻿
top_comment.author: Nick Machiavelli

comments.text:
We will take care of it we are anonymous join are members and stop this 
nonsense
comments.author: anonymous anonymous

comments.text:
+Damon Ashley Damon, this person was relating a specific set of 
circumstances. Just because a person doesn't address all victims when 
relating to a story doesn't mean they are not appalled by male rape. We 
have come a long way in society, but it hurts me to see how far we have to 
go. Many men who have been sexually abused or raped have talked to me. We 
have yet to foster an environment in our society and its constructs that is 
supportive of survivors, regardless of gender. In fact, I acknowledge men 
have it the worst. When including prison rape, and one must, I know its 
projected that it's highly possible that MORE men than women have been 
raped. Also, of ALL the people I have talked to who have experienced CSA or 
rape, only two people reported; I was one of them. The other was a young 
twelve-year-old boy. When he told me, we were twelve and fourteen. His dad 
was an attorney. He told his family immediately, and his assailant was 
serving time, though not nearly enough. I also know of a man who was 
falsely accused, so to speak. She lied about her age. Feeling so sickened 
he had been with a fifteen-year-old, he was full of self-recrimination and 
self-blame that he pled guilty and will remain on the sex offender 
registry. All that said, if you are a survivor, it must be horrible to see 
and experience the societal differences when speaking to male sexual 
assault. It is surely never funny. The prevalence of jokes is despicable. 
Also, I am not personally aware of another survivor, male or female, who 
takes male sexual assault less seriously. Just know, please, that usually 
those impassioned about the rape of a girl/woman would feel just as 
impassioned about the rape of a boy/man in the same circumstances.
Fighting for all people to be equal and free of violence.
comments.author: Stormie Weathers

comments.text:
+Damon Ashley I give a shit about men being raped in prison. In addition to 
the fact that I have a friend acquitted for spending 16 years in prison for 
a crime he was proved not to have committed.
comments.author: Nick Machiavelli

comments.text:
and im fucking sick of people not giving a shit about men being raped. but 
thats life. get on with it.
comments.author: Damon Ashley

comments.text:
In prison? Rapists should be hanged. Result: no more rapists and decrease 
in over population.
comments.author: Ray Incognito

top_comment.text:
She was probably a wild child and a flirt, but that in no way makes it 
right to rape a   girl that is too young and trusting to know better. 
 Screw that athlete bullshit and make him pay for the pervert  he is.  Hope 
he reads this because he is the devil.  I hate him.                     
 Like to know how this turned out.﻿
top_comment.author: Sancho z

comments.text:
+Lencho san I didn't mean to imply defense of rape of any kind. Much less 
that of a minor... I think I commented without all the facts. I agree with 
your statement.
comments.author: blaze556922

comments.text:
+blaze556922 That is what I read into your comment. Attractive wild child 
flirt or not, what he did to that girl was sick.
comments.author: Sancho z

comments.text: +ammosmoke Never condoned anything like that. Nice try...
comments.author: blaze556922

comments.text:
+blaze556922
Umm... yeah she was 14. And there is a big difference between "finding a 
young girl attractive" and shoving your penis in her vagina when she is 
passed out drunk.  Fuck you and every person who thinks like you.
comments.author: ammosmoke

comments.text:
So he is a pervert for find a young girl attractive that wanted to get 
drunk with him... wow, how flawed is your logic?
comments.author: blaze556922

top_comment.text:
The government should fear its citizens, not vice versa. Anonymous is a 
perfect example of the citizens of a nation exerting their power over the 
government. Provided they are moral and have integrity, groups like 
Anonymous are necessary to keep any semblance of justice in an increasingly 
corrupt system.﻿
top_comment.author: Jimmeh Teh Cat

comments.text: +Blue Eyes White Teddy We have many hacktivists.
comments.author: Anonymous C@P

comments.text:
anonymous needs some REALLY REALLY good hackers to make the governments 
fear them.
comments.author: Blue Eyes White Teddy
